company.name: Tyre Emergency Ltd
company.description: Fast response emergency roadside tyre replacement across Nottinghamshire. We get to you quickly, keep you informed, and get the job done right. Covering Mansfield, Newark, Worksop, Retford and surrounding areas.

testimonials.name: Emma Richards
testimonials.text: Brilliant service! Got a flat tyre on my way to an important meeting and they were with me in 30 minutes. Professional, friendly, and saved the day. Can't recommend them enough!

testimonials.name: Tom Harrison
testimonials.text: Best tyre service I've ever used. Came to my house while I was working from home, fitted new tyres in no time, and the price was very fair. No more wasting half a day at a garage!

testimonials.name: Lisa Thompson
testimonials.text: Had an emergency on the A1 and these guys were absolute lifesavers. Quick response, sorted my locking wheel nut problem on the spot, and got me back on the road safely. 5 stars all the way!

areas.name: Newark
areas.localInformation: Newark-on-Trent is a historic market town in Nottinghamshire, known for its castle and strategic location. Our mobile tyre fitting service is based in Newark and covers the town and all surrounding villages. We provide rapid emergency response and convenient mobile tyre services throughout the Newark area, from roadside assistance to home and workplace fitting.

areas.name: Worksop
areas.localInformation: Worksop is a market town in the Bassetlaw district of Nottinghamshire, close to the border with South Yorkshire. Our mobile tyre service covers Worksop and the surrounding areas with fast response times. Whether you need emergency tyre assistance or scheduled mobile fitting at your home or workplace, we're here to help.

areas.name: Mansfield
areas.localInformation: Mansfield is a market town and the main administrative centre in Mansfield District, Nottinghamshire. Our mobile tyre fitting service operates throughout Mansfield and the surrounding areas, providing convenient and professional tyre services. From emergency call-outs to scheduled appointments, we bring the garage to you across Mansfield and beyond.

areas.name: Retford
areas.localInformation: Retford (East Retford) is a market town in the Bassetlaw district of Nottinghamshire, situated on the River Idle. Our mobile tyre service covers Retford and all surrounding villages with reliable, fast response times. Whether you're in the town centre or surrounding rural areas, we provide professional mobile tyre fitting and emergency assistance wherever you need us.

home.description: Emergency roadside tyre replacement across Nottinghamshire. Fast 30-60 minute response, 7 days a week. We come to you - home, work, or roadside. Over 400 five-star reviews. Covering Newark, Mansfield, Worksop, and Retford.
home.heroHeading: Stuck With a Flat? We'll Be There in 30-60 Minutes
home.heroSubheading: Emergency roadside tyre replacement across Nottinghamshire. 7 days a week, 6am to 6pm.
home.mainHeading: Emergency Tyre Service That Actually Shows Up
mainContent: Getting stuck with a flat tyre is stressful - you're on a busy road, running late, and the last thing you need is waiting hours for help. That's why we built Tyre Emergency Ltd around one simple idea: get to you as quickly as possible and sort it out properly. We're talking 30-60 minute response times across Nottinghamshire, not vague 'within 4 hours' promises. Our vans are stocked with tyres for most vehicles, so we show up ready to fix your problem, not just assess it.

What makes us different? Clear communication throughout. We share our live location with you so you know exactly when we'll arrive - no guesswork, no endless waiting. Transparent pricing with no hidden fees or surprise charges. Our technicians are experienced professionals with the tools and know-how to handle locking wheel nuts and TPMS sensors on the spot. We've earned over 400 five-star reviews on Google by being reliable, honest, and genuinely helpful when people need us most.

We cover Newark, Mansfield, Worksop, Retford, and all the surrounding areas. Open 7 days a week from 6am to 6pm - tyre emergencies don't respect weekends or bank holidays. We work with cars, vans, caravans, motorhomes, trailers, and SUVs. Need help now? Call us on 0330 133 9311 and we'll be on our way.

about.description: Meet Tyre Emergency Ltd - Nottinghamshire's emergency roadside tyre specialists. Fast response times, honest pricing, and over 400 five-star reviews. Based in Newark, serving all of Nottinghamshire.
mainContent: Being stuck on the side of the road is stressful. You're surrounded by traffic, running late, and you just want someone to show up and sort it out. That's exactly why we started Tyre Emergency Ltd - to provide fast response tyre replacement when you need it most. Our goal is simple: get to you quickly, keep you informed, and get the job done properly so you can get back on the road safely.

We've built the entire business around efficiency. Tyres are stored close to our technicians so we're not wasting time collecting stock. We share our live location during call-outs so you know exactly when we'll arrive. Our pricing is transparent with no hidden fees. And our technicians have the tools on board to handle locking wheel nuts and TPMS sensor issues on the spot.

Founded by Dean Spicer, who's been in the tyre trade since the age of 20. Born in Dorset and spent years working for large national chains and smaller family businesses - both mobile and depot work. That experience taught what good service looks like and what frustrates customers. The result? A business focused on quick response times, clear communication, fair pricing, and getting people back on the road without the drama.

We work with cars, vans, caravans, motorhomes, trailers, and SUVs. We're typically only 30 minutes away from major towns across Newark, Mansfield, Worksop, Retford, and surrounding areas. Open 7 days a week from 6am to 6pm. We've earned over 400 five-star reviews on Google from genuine customers who needed help and got the service they deserved.
Need emergency tyre assistance? Call us on 0330 133 9311 or email contact@tyreemergency.com. We'll be on our way while you're still on the phone.

mobileTyreFitting.description: We bring the garage to you! Expert mobile tyre fitting at your home, workplace, or roadside. No queues, no waiting - just great service at your convenience.
mobileTyreFitting.heroSubheading: Your Tyres Fitted While You Get On With Your Day - At Home, At Work, or Even Roadside
mainContent: Why waste half your day sitting in a garage waiting room? We've revolutionised tyre fitting by bringing the entire service to your doorstep. Whether you're working from home, parked at the office, or stuck on the roadside with a flat - our fully equipped mobile units roll up with everything needed to get you back on the road fast.

Picture this: You're at home having breakfast while we fit your tyres in the driveway. Or you're finishing up that meeting while we're sorting your vehicle in the car park. That's the beauty of mobile tyre fitting - your tyres get done while your life carries on as normal. We stock premium brands and budget-friendly options for every vehicle type, all fitted to manufacturer specifications with professional wheel balancing, TPMS resets, and free old tyre disposal included.

Our mobile vans aren't just vehicles - they're fully equipped tyre centres on wheels. We use the same professional-grade equipment as traditional garages, so you're never compromising on quality for convenience. The difference? You're in control. No more sitting around wondering when your car will be ready. You choose the time, you choose the place, and we do the rest while you get on with what matters to you.

Every technician on our team is fully qualified, insured, and committed to keeping you safe on the road. We believe in transparent pricing - no hidden fees, no surprises, just honest quotes before we start any work. Need tyres today? We offer same-day service across our coverage area. Ready to experience the smarter way to get tyres fitted? Get your free quote now and discover why our customers never go back to traditional garages.

emergencyMobileTyreFitting.description: Stranded with a flat tyre? Fast emergency roadside tyre replacement across Nottinghamshire. 30-60 minute response time, 7 days a week. We come to you with tyres in stock, ready to get you moving.
emergencyMobileTyreFitting.heroSubheading: Stuck With a Flat Tyre? We'll Get to You Fast - 30-60 Minute Response Across Nottinghamshire
mainContent: Flat tyre on a busy road? Blowout on the way to work? Don't panic. This is exactly what we do. Tyre Emergency Ltd specializes in fast response emergency tyre replacement across Nottinghamshire. We're talking 30-60 minute response times, not vague 'we'll be there eventually' promises. One call to us and we're on our way - fully stocked van, experienced technician, and the tools to get you back on the road safely and quickly.

What sets us apart is how we've built the business around efficiency. Tyres are stored close to our fitters, so we're not wasting time driving around collecting stock. We share our live location with you during the callout, so you know exactly where we are and when we'll arrive - no guesswork, no endless waiting. Our vans carry tyres for most vehicles, so chances are we'll have what you need on board. If not, we'll source it fast. And our technicians have the experience and equipment to handle tricky situations like seized locking wheel nuts and TPMS sensor issues right there at the roadside.

We operate 7 days a week from 6am to 6pm because tyre emergencies don't wait for Monday morning. Sunday afternoon blowout? Saturday morning flat before your holiday? We're available. We cover Newark, Mansfield, Worksop, Retford, and all the surrounding areas in Nottinghamshire - typically only 30 minutes away from major towns. We work with cars, vans, caravans, motorhomes, trailers, and SUVs. Clear, transparent pricing before we start work - no hidden 'emergency' fees or surprise charges when you're already stressed.

It's stressful being stranded on a busy road. We get that. That's why we've earned over 400 five-star reviews on Google - not by being the cheapest, but by showing up quickly, keeping people informed, and sorting the problem properly so they can get on with their day. Need emergency tyre help now? Call 0330 133 9311 and we'll be on our way while you're still on the phone.

lockingWheelNutRemoval.description: Lost your locking wheel nut key? We provide professional mobile locking wheel nut removal across Nottinghamshire. Safe removal using specialist tools with no damage to your wheels. We come to you.
lockingWheelNutRemoval.heroSubheading: Lost Your Locking Wheel Nut Key? We'll Sort It - Mobile Service With Specialist Tools
mainContent: You need a tyre changed. Then you realize the locking wheel nut key is missing. Check the glovebox - not there. Check the boot - nothing. Now what? Most places either can't help or charge extortionate prices. We've got the solution: mobile locking wheel nut removal across Nottinghamshire using specialist tools that won't damage your alloys. We've removed thousands of locking wheel nuts over the years, and we can remove yours too - at your home, workplace, or roadside.

Locking wheel nuts are designed to be secure, which makes them tricky to remove without the key. But we're equipped for this. We carry specialist locking wheel nut removal tools on our vans - proper professional kit designed for the job, not hammers and chisels that destroy your expensive alloy wheels. Our technicians have the experience to remove seized, rounded, or locked wheel nuts safely without damaging your wheels, studs, or vehicle. We deal with this regularly, so what seems like a major problem to you is just another job we know how to handle properly.

The beauty of our mobile service? We come to you. No need to get your car recovered to a garage at ridiculous expense. No taking time off work to sit in a waiting room. We'll come to your location with the specialist tools needed, remove the locking wheel nuts safely, and if you need tyres fitted at the same time, we can do that immediately - our vans are fully stocked. Or we can simply replace the locking nuts with standard ones so you never have this hassle again. Your choice.

Operating 7 days a week across Newark, Mansfield, Worksop, Retford, and all of Nottinghamshire. Transparent pricing with no hidden fees - we'll quote you honestly before we start. Most locking wheel nut removals are done quickly without fuss or drama. Need locking wheel nuts removed? Call us on 0330 133 9311 and we'll handle it properly without damaging your wheels.

tpms.description: Professional mobile TPMS service across Nottinghamshire. Tyre pressure sensor diagnostics, replacement, and programming. Keep your warning light off and your tyres monitored properly.
tpms.heroSubheading: Warning Light On Your Dashboard? We'll Sort Your TPMS Sensors - Mobile Service Across Nottinghamshire
mainContent: That tyre pressure warning light glowing on your dashboard? It's not going away on its own. Modern vehicles have TPMS (Tyre Pressure Monitoring System) sensors that alert you when tyre pressure drops below safe levels. When that light comes on - or stays on after you've had new tyres fitted - you need proper TPMS service. We handle TPMS diagnostics, sensor replacement, and programming across Nottinghamshire, and we come to you. No garage visit needed.

TPMS isn't just about turning off an annoying light. These sensors are important safety equipment that monitor your tyre pressure in real-time, warning you of dangerous pressure loss before it causes problems. Our mobile vans carry TPMS diagnostic equipment and replacement sensors for most vehicle makes. We can diagnose faulty sensors, replace failed ones, program new sensors to your vehicle's system, and reset everything so it works properly. Whether it's one sensor or a full set, we'll sort it at your location.

We deal with TPMS regularly: faulty sensor diagnostics, replacement of failed or damaged sensors, programming new sensors to your vehicle, sensor valve replacement, and fixing intermittent TPMS warnings. We can source manufacturer-specific sensors or quality universal programmable sensors that work just as well at better prices. If you're having new tyres fitted, we'll check and service your TPMS sensors at the same time - one visit, everything sorted properly.

Operating 7 days a week across Newark, Mansfield, Worksop, Retford, and all of Nottinghamshire. Transparent pricing with no hidden fees, and we'll only replace what actually needs replacing - no unnecessary upselling. Don't ignore that warning light - it's there for your safety. Call us on 0330 133 9311 and we'll get your TPMS working properly again.

cookie.description: Cookie policy for Tyre Emergency Ltd. How we use cookies and similar technologies on our website. What cookies we use, why we use them, and how to control them.
mainContent: 1. INTRODUCTION

This Cookie Policy explains how Tyre Emergency Ltd ('we', 'us', 'our') uses cookies and similar technologies on our website https://tyreemergency.com. This policy should be read alongside our Privacy Policy, which provides more information about how we collect and use personal data.

By using our website, you consent to the use of essential cookies that are necessary for the website to function. For non-essential cookies such as analytics cookies (Google Analytics via Google Tag Manager), we will ask for your consent through our cookie consent banner. If you do not agree with our use of cookies, you should change your browser settings accordingly or stop using our website.

Company Details: Tyre Emergency Ltd, Newark, Nottinghamshire NG22 8GA. Company Number: 15362025. VAT Number: 456597051. ICO Registration: ZB755609. Phone: 0330 133 9311. Email: contact@tyreemergency.com. Website: https://tyreemergency.com
Last Updated: 11 January 2026
2. WHAT ARE COOKIES?

Cookies are small text files that are placed on your device (computer, smartphone, or tablet) when you visit a website. Cookies are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and to provide information to website owners. Cookies allow websites to recognize your device and remember information about your visit, such as your preferences or login status.

Cookies can be 'session cookies' (which are deleted when you close your browser) or 'persistent cookies' (which remain on your device for a set period or until you delete them). Cookies can also be 'first-party cookies' (set by the website you are visiting) or 'third-party cookies' (set by a different website, such as an analytics or advertising service).

In addition to traditional cookies, we also use similar technologies such as browser local storage, which stores data locally in your browser similar to cookies but with different technical characteristics.
3. WHY WE USE COOKIES

We use cookies and similar technologies for the following reasons: to remember your cookie consent preferences, to protect our website forms from spam and abuse, to enable essential website functionality, to analyze how visitors use our website through Google Analytics (with your consent), and to improve your experience on our website. We do not use cookies for advertising or marketing purposes.
4. COOKIES WE USE
Our website uses minimal tracking technologies. We are committed to transparency about what we use and why.
4.1 STRICTLY NECESSARY COOKIES AND STORAGE
These are essential for our website to function properly and cannot be disabled without severely affecting your use of the website.

localStorage: cookieConsent - Purpose: Stores your cookie consent preference so we don't show you the cookie banner on every visit. Type: Browser local storage (not a traditional cookie). Duration: Persistent (remains until you clear your browser data). Category: Strictly necessary. Legal basis: Legitimate interest (remembering your consent choice).

Note: Despite our cookie consent banner referring to 'cookies', we actually use localStorage (a browser storage mechanism) rather than traditional cookies to store your consent preference. This distinction is technical but worth noting for transparency.
4.2 FUNCTIONAL COOKIES (THIRD-PARTY)
These cookies enable specific functionality on our website, such as form submission and spam protection.

Google reCAPTCHA Cookies - Purpose: Google reCAPTCHA protects our quote form from spam and automated abuse. It analyzes your behavior on the page to determine whether you are a human or a bot. Provider: Google LLC. Cookies set: Google may set various cookies including _GRECAPTCHA, rc::a, rc::b, rc::c. Duration: Varies (session cookies and persistent cookies up to 6 months). Category: Functional (required for form submission). Legal basis: Legitimate interest (protecting our systems and preventing abuse). Privacy policy: https://policies.google.com/privacy. Opt-out: You cannot opt out of reCAPTCHA cookies if you wish to use our quote form. However, you can contact us directly by phone or email instead.

Netlify Forms - Purpose: Netlify processes our website forms and may set cookies for form functionality, session management, and spam prevention. Provider: Netlify, Inc. Cookies set: May include session cookies for form processing. Duration: Varies (typically session cookies). Category: Functional (required for form submission). Legal basis: Legitimate interest (processing your quote requests). Privacy policy: https://www.netlify.com/privacy/.
4.3 ANALYTICS AND TRACKING COOKIES (THIRD-PARTY)
These cookies help us understand how visitors use our website so we can improve user experience and website performance.

Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager - Purpose: We use Google Analytics (via Google Tag Manager) to track and analyze website traffic, user behavior, and website performance. This helps us understand which pages are most popular, how users navigate our site, and where improvements can be made. Provider: Google LLC. Cookies set: Google Analytics sets various cookies including _ga, _ga_*, _gid, and _gat. These cookies collect information such as pages visited, time spent on pages, traffic sources, device and browser information, and general location data (city/region level, not precise location). Duration: Varies by cookie - some are session cookies, others persist for up to 2 years. Category: Analytics / Performance. Legal basis: Consent (you can opt out via our cookie consent banner). Privacy policy: https://policies.google.com/privacy. Data retention: We have configured Google Analytics to retain data for 14 months. Opt-out: You can opt out by adjusting your cookie preferences in our cookie banner, using browser settings, or installing the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on at https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout.

Important Note About Google Analytics: The data collected by Google Analytics is used solely to improve our website and understand our audience. We do NOT use Google Analytics data for advertising or remarketing purposes. Google may use this data for its own purposes as described in their privacy policy.
4.4 OPTIONAL THIRD-PARTY SERVICES

Elfsight Widgets - Purpose: We may use Elfsight widgets to display reviews or other interactive content on our website. If Elfsight widgets are present, they may set cookies for functionality and analytics. Provider: Elfsight. Cookies set: Various cookies for widget functionality. Duration: Varies. Category: Functional / Analytics (depending on the specific widget). Legal basis: Consent or legitimate interest. Privacy policy: https://elfsight.com/privacy-policy/. Current status: Elfsight widgets may or may not be active on the site at any given time.
4.5 COOKIES WE DO NOT USE

We want to be clear about what we do NOT use: Facebook Pixel or Social Media Tracking - We do not use Facebook Pixel, LinkedIn Insight Tag, or any social media tracking pixels. Advertising or Remarketing Cookies - We do not use Google Ads remarketing, Facebook Ads, or any other advertising cookies that follow you around the web. Marketing Automation - We do not use marketing automation platforms that track your behavior across visits.
While we do use Google Analytics for understanding website traffic, we do not use it for advertising purposes. Our tracking is limited to improving user experience and website performance.
5. HOW TO CONTROL AND DELETE COOKIES

5.1 Browser Settings - Most web browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings. You can set your browser to: refuse all cookies, accept only certain cookies, delete cookies when you close your browser, or notify you when a website tries to place a cookie.

Here's how to manage cookies in common browsers: Google Chrome - Settings > Privacy and security > Cookies and other site data. Mozilla Firefox - Settings > Privacy & Security > Cookies and Site Data. Microsoft Edge - Settings > Cookies and site permissions > Cookies and site data. Safari - Preferences > Privacy > Cookies and website data. For mobile browsers, consult your device's help documentation.

5.2 Disabling Specific Cookies - To disable Google Analytics: You can opt out of Google Analytics by adjusting your cookie preferences in our cookie consent banner when you first visit the site. You can also install the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on available at https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout. To disable Google reCAPTCHA: Note that disabling reCAPTCHA cookies will prevent you from submitting our quote form. You can contact us directly by phone (0330 133 9311) or email (contact@tyreemergency.com) instead. To disable Netlify cookies: Blocking Netlify cookies may prevent form submission. Again, you can contact us directly by alternative methods.

5.3 Clearing Your Browser Data - You can delete all cookies and local storage from your browser at any time: Chrome - Settings > Privacy and security > Clear browsing data > Cookies and other site data. Firefox - Settings > Privacy & Security > Cookies and Site Data > Clear Data. Edge - Settings > Privacy, search, and services > Clear browsing data > Cookies and other site data. Safari - Preferences > Privacy > Manage Website Data > Remove All.
Note that clearing cookies will also delete your cookie consent preference, so you may see our cookie banner again on your next visit.

5.4 Impact of Disabling Cookies - If you disable or refuse cookies: You may not be able to submit our quote form (you can still contact us by phone or email). You will see our cookie consent banner on every visit if you clear localStorage. Essential website functionality should still work. You will not be able to use any interactive widgets that rely on cookies. If you disable analytics cookies (Google Analytics), we won't be able to track your visit for website improvement purposes, but this will not affect your ability to use the website.
Our website is designed to work with minimal cookies, so disabling non-essential cookies should not significantly impact your experience, provided you use alternative contact methods if needed.
6. THIRD-PARTY WEBSITES

Our website contains links to third-party websites, including social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, YouTube) and Google My Business. These websites have their own cookie policies that are independent of ours. We are not responsible for the cookies or privacy practices of third-party websites. We recommend reviewing the cookie policies of any third-party websites you visit from our site.
7. CHANGES TO THIS COOKIE POLICY

We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our use of cookies, legal requirements, or website functionality. The 'Last Updated' date at the top of this document indicates when changes were last made. If we make significant changes, we will notify you by updating this page and, where appropriate, displaying a prominent notice on our website. Continued use of our website after changes constitutes acceptance of the revised Cookie Policy.
8. MORE INFORMATION ABOUT COOKIES

If you would like more information about cookies and how they work, you can visit: All About Cookies - www.allaboutcookies.org. Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) - www.ico.org.uk/for-organisations/direct-marketing-and-privacy-and-electronic-communications/guide-to-pecr/cookies-and-similar-technologies. Your Online Choices - www.youronlinechoices.com (information about behavioral advertising and how to opt out).
9. CONTACT US

If you have any questions about this Cookie Policy or how we use cookies on our website, please contact us: Tyre Emergency Ltd, Newark, Nottinghamshire NG22 8GA. Phone: 0330 133 9311. Email: contact@tyreemergency.com. Website: https://tyreemergency.com
For questions about your personal data and privacy, please see our Privacy Policy at https://tyreemergency.com/privacy-policy.

privacy.description: Privacy policy for Tyre Emergency Ltd. How we collect, use, and protect your personal data. GDPR-compliant. ICO registered. Your rights to access, delete, and control your information.
mainContent: 1. INTRODUCTION

Tyre Emergency Ltd ('we', 'us', 'our') is committed to protecting your privacy and personal data. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, store, and protect your personal information when you use our mobile tyre fitting services or interact with our website.

We are registered with the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) under registration number ZB755609 and comply with the UK General Data Protection Regulation (UK GDPR) and the Data Protection Act 2018.

Company Details: Tyre Emergency Ltd, Newark, Nottinghamshire NG22 8GA. Company Number: 15362025. VAT Number: 456597051. ICO Registration: ZB755609. Phone: 0330 133 9311. Email: contact@tyreemergency.com. Website: https://tyreemergency.com
Last Updated: 11 January 2026
2. DATA CONTROLLER

Tyre Emergency Ltd is the data controller responsible for your personal data. This means we determine how and why your personal information is processed. If you have any questions about how we handle your data, please contact us using the details above.
3. WHAT PERSONAL DATA WE COLLECT

3.1 Information You Provide to Us - When you request a quote or book our services through our website form or by phone, we collect the following information: your full name, email address, phone number, postcode or location, vehicle registration number (optional), the service you require, and any additional details you provide about your situation or requirements.

3.2 Information Collected Automatically - When you visit our website, certain technical information may be collected automatically, including your IP address, browser type and version, operating system, referring website, pages viewed, and time/date of visit. This information is collected through browser storage (localStorage) and may be collected by third-party services we use (see Section 6).

3.3 Information We Do NOT Collect - We do not collect sensitive personal data (such as health information, racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs, or biometric data). We do not create user accounts, so we do not collect passwords or login credentials. We do not knowingly collect information from children under 16 years of age.
4. HOW WE USE YOUR PERSONAL DATA

4.1 Purpose of Processing - We use your personal data for the following purposes: to provide you with a quote for our services, to deliver the mobile tyre fitting services you have requested, to contact you about your booking or service request, to respond to your enquiries and provide customer support, to process payments for our services, to send you service-related communications (such as appointment confirmations or technician location updates), to comply with legal obligations (such as tax and accounting requirements), and to improve our services and customer experience.

4.2 Legal Basis for Processing - We process your personal data based on the following legal grounds: Consent - when you submit your information through our quote form, you consent to us using that information to contact you and provide a quote. Contract Performance - when you book our services, we need to process your data to fulfil our contractual obligations to you. Legitimate Interests - we have a legitimate interest in operating our business efficiently, improving our services, and preventing fraud. Legal Obligation - we are required by law to retain certain information for tax, accounting, and regulatory purposes.

4.3 Marketing Communications - We do not send marketing emails or promotional materials unless you have explicitly opted in to receive them. If you have opted in, you can unsubscribe at any time by contacting us or clicking the unsubscribe link in any marketing email.
5. HOW LONG WE KEEP YOUR DATA

5.1 Data Retention Period - We retain personal data collected through quote requests for a maximum of 1 month from the date of submission. If there is no progression towards booking our services within this period, your data is automatically deleted from our system.

5.2 Completed Jobs - For completed jobs where services have been provided and paid for, we retain your information for up to 6 years to comply with UK tax and accounting regulations (HMRC requirements). This includes your name, contact details, service details, invoice information, and payment records.

5.3 Warranty Claims - If you make a warranty claim under our 30-day workmanship warranty, we will retain relevant information for the duration of the warranty period plus a reasonable period afterwards to handle any disputes (typically up to 1 year from the date of service).

5.4 Your Right to Request Earlier Deletion - You can request that we delete your personal data earlier than the standard retention periods, subject to our legal obligations to retain certain information for tax and accounting purposes. See Section 9 for how to exercise this right.
6. WHO WE SHARE YOUR DATA WITH

6.1 Third-Party Service Providers - We use the following third-party services that may process your personal data: Netlify - Our website forms are processed through Netlify Forms. Netlify acts as a data processor and stores form submissions securely. Netlify's privacy policy is available at https://www.netlify.com/privacy/. Google reCAPTCHA - We use Google reCAPTCHA to protect our forms from spam and abuse. Google collects technical information to determine whether you are a human or a bot. Google's privacy policy is available at https://policies.google.com/privacy. Elfsight - We may use Elfsight widgets on our website for displaying reviews or other interactive content. Elfsight may collect usage data. Elfsight's privacy policy is available at https://elfsight.com/privacy-policy/.

6.2 Payment Processors - When you make a payment, your payment card details are processed directly by our payment service provider. We do not store your full payment card details on our systems. Payment processors comply with PCI-DSS security standards.

6.3 Legal Requirements - We may disclose your personal data if required to do so by law, court order, or other legal process, or if we believe disclosure is necessary to protect our rights, your safety, or the safety of others.

6.4 Business Transfers - If our business is sold, merged, or restructured, your personal data may be transferred to the new owner, but it will remain subject to the terms of this Privacy Policy or an equivalent policy.
6.5 No Third-Party Marketing - We do not sell, rent, or share your personal data with third parties for their marketing purposes.
7. DATA SECURITY

We take appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data against unauthorized access, accidental loss, destruction, or damage. These measures include: secure data storage with encryption, access controls limiting who can view your data within our organization, secure transmission of data using SSL/TLS encryption (HTTPS), regular security reviews and updates to our systems, and password protection and authentication for our internal systems.

However, no method of transmission over the internet or electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to protect your personal data, we cannot guarantee absolute security. If you become aware of any security breach or unauthorized access to your data, please contact us immediately.
8. INTERNATIONAL DATA TRANSFERS

Your personal data is primarily stored and processed within the United Kingdom. Some of our third-party service providers (such as Netlify and Google) may process data outside the UK or European Economic Area (EEA). Where data is transferred internationally, we ensure that appropriate safeguards are in place, such as: Standard Contractual Clauses approved by the UK Information Commissioner's Office, adequacy decisions recognizing that the destination country provides adequate data protection, or certification under recognized data protection frameworks.
We ensure that any international transfers comply with UK GDPR requirements and that your data receives an equivalent level of protection.
9. YOUR RIGHTS UNDER UK GDPR

9.1 Right of Access - You have the right to request a copy of the personal data we hold about you. This is known as a 'subject access request'. We will provide this information free of charge within one month of your request.
9.2 Right to Rectification - You have the right to request that we correct any inaccurate or incomplete personal data we hold about you. We will correct the data within one month of your request.

9.3 Right to Erasure ('Right to be Forgotten') - You have the right to request that we delete your personal data in certain circumstances, such as: the data is no longer necessary for the purposes for which it was collected, you withdraw your consent (where consent was the legal basis for processing), you object to the processing and there are no overriding legitimate grounds, or the data has been unlawfully processed. Please note that we may be required to retain certain data to comply with legal obligations (such as tax records for 6 years).

9.4 Right to Restrict Processing - You have the right to request that we restrict how we use your personal data in certain circumstances, such as while we verify the accuracy of data you have contested, or while we assess your objection to processing.

9.5 Right to Data Portability - You have the right to receive your personal data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format (such as CSV or JSON) and to transmit that data to another organization, where technically feasible.

9.6 Right to Object - You have the right to object to our processing of your personal data where we are relying on legitimate interests as the legal basis for processing. If you object, we will stop processing your data unless we can demonstrate compelling legitimate grounds that override your interests.

9.7 Right to Withdraw Consent - Where we are processing your data based on your consent, you have the right to withdraw that consent at any time. This will not affect the lawfulness of processing that occurred before you withdrew consent.
9.8 Automated Decision-Making and Profiling - We do not use automated decision-making or profiling that produces legal effects or similarly significantly affects you.
10. HOW TO EXERCISE YOUR RIGHTS
To exercise any of your rights under UK GDPR, please contact us: Email: contact@tyreemergency.com. Phone: 0330 133 9311. Post: Tyre Emergency Ltd, Newark, Nottinghamshire NG22 8GA.

When making a request, please provide sufficient information to help us identify you and process your request. We may ask for proof of identity to ensure we are releasing information to the correct person. We will respond to your request within one month. In complex cases, we may extend this by up to two additional months, but we will inform you if this is necessary and explain the reasons for the delay.
11. COMPLAINTS

If you are unhappy with how we have handled your personal data or how we have responded to a request to exercise your rights, you have the right to complain to the supervisory authority. In the UK, this is the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO).
Information Commissioner's Office: Website: https://ico.org.uk. Phone: 0303 123 1113. Post: Information Commissioner's Office, Wycliffe House, Water Lane, Wilmslow, Cheshire SK9 5AF.
You can also submit a complaint online through the ICO's website. We would appreciate the opportunity to resolve any concerns before you contact the ICO, so please contact us first if possible.
12. COOKIES AND TRACKING TECHNOLOGIES

Our website uses cookies and similar technologies for essential functionality and analytics. For full details about cookies and similar technologies we use, please see our Cookie Policy at https://tyreemergency.com/cookie-policy.

In summary, we use: localStorage to remember your cookie consent preference, Google Analytics (via Google Tag Manager) to track website usage and improve user experience (with your consent), Google reCAPTCHA (which may set cookies for bot detection), and Netlify Forms (which may set cookies for form functionality). We do not use advertising cookies or marketing tracking technologies for remarketing purposes.
13. LINKS TO OTHER WEBSITES

Our website may contain links to third-party websites, such as our social media profiles (Facebook, Instagram, YouTube) or Google My Business. We are not responsible for the privacy practices or content of these external sites. We encourage you to read the privacy policies of any third-party websites you visit.
14. CHANGES TO THIS PRIVACY POLICY

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices, legal requirements, or service offerings. The 'Last Updated' date at the top of this document indicates when changes were last made. We will notify you of any material changes by updating this page and, where appropriate, by contacting you directly if we have your contact information. Continued use of our services after changes constitutes acceptance of the revised Privacy Policy.
15. CHILDREN'S PRIVACY

Our services are not directed at children under 16 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal data from children. If you are a parent or guardian and believe your child has provided us with personal data, please contact us and we will delete that information from our systems.
16. CONTACT US

If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding this Privacy Policy or how we handle your personal data, please contact us: Tyre Emergency Ltd, Newark, Nottinghamshire NG22 8GA. Phone: 0330 133 9311. Email: contact@tyreemergency.com. Website: https://tyreemergency.com
We aim to respond to all enquiries within 5 working days.

terms.description: Terms and conditions for Tyre Emergency Ltd mobile tyre fitting services. Covering service areas, response times, payment terms, deposits, warranties, and liability. Last updated January 11, 2026.
mainContent: 1. INTRODUCTION

These Terms and Conditions ('Terms') govern the provision of mobile tyre fitting and related services by Tyre Emergency Ltd ('we', 'us', 'our') to customers ('you', 'your'). By requesting a quote, booking our services, or allowing us to carry out work on your vehicle, you agree to be bound by these Terms.

Company Details: Tyre Emergency Ltd, Newark, Nottinghamshire NG22 8GA. Company Number: 15362025. VAT Number: 456597051. ICO Registration: ZB755609. Phone: 0330 133 9311. Email: contact@tyreemergency.com. Website: https://tyreemergency.com
Last Updated: 11 January 2026
2. SERVICES PROVIDED

2.1 Service Description - We provide emergency mobile tyre fitting services across Nottinghamshire, including tyre replacement, locking wheel nut removal, and TPMS (Tyre Pressure Monitoring System) diagnostics and repair. Our services are delivered at your location, whether at home, workplace, or roadside.

2.2 Coverage Areas and Fees - We operate in the following primary areas: Newark (postcodes: NG22, NG23, NG24), Mansfield (postcodes: NG18, NG19, NG20, NG21), Worksop (postcodes: S80, S81), and Retford (postcodes: DN22). Fees are applied to all mobile services, with specific charges for each postcode region. Our maximum service radius is 30 miles. We may provide services outside these areas at our discretion. Additional charges may apply for locations outside our standard service area, and deposits may be required in certain situations (see Section 4).

2.3 Operating Hours - We operate 7 days a week, Monday to Sunday: 6:00 AM - 6:00 PM. Emergency call-outs are available during these hours. We do operate outside these hours, but an additional out of hours fee will be applied.
3. RESPONSE TIMES AND SERVICE AVAILABILITY

3.1 Target Response Times and ETA - We aim to respond to emergency call-outs within 30-60 minutes of receiving your call during our operating hours. We will provide an ETA (Estimated Time of Arrival) during the quote process. This is an estimate, not a guarantee.

3.2 No Guarantee of Response Time - Response times are subject to factors beyond our control, including but not limited to: traffic conditions, weather, distance to your location, technician availability, and volume of simultaneous call-outs. We will always endeavour to reach you as quickly as possible, but we cannot guarantee specific arrival times.

3.3 Service Refusal - We reserve the right to refuse service in circumstances including but not limited to: unsafe working conditions, threatening or abusive behaviour, locations that are inaccessible or unsafe for our technicians, or situations where we determine we cannot complete the work safely and professionally.
4. PRICING, PAYMENT TERMS, AND DEPOSITS

4.1 Quotations - We provide quotations based on the information you provide about your vehicle and required services. All quotations are estimates and may be subject to change if the actual work required differs from the information provided. We will inform you of any price changes before commencing work.

4.2 Standard Payment Terms - For standard emergency call-outs within our primary service areas, payment is due in full upon completion of the work. We will not release your vehicle or leave the site until payment has been received in full.

4.3 Deposit Requirements - We may require a deposit for certain jobs, including but not limited to: services outside our standard coverage areas, requests for specific tyre brands or sizes that must be specially sourced, jobs requiring advance ordering of parts or materials, and multiple vehicle bookings or large jobs. The deposit amount will be determined on a case-by-case basis and communicated to you at the time of booking. Deposits are typically paid via bank transfer or card payment before we allocate resources to your job.

4.4 Non-Refundable Deposits and Out of Hours Payment - IMPORTANT: Once a deposit has been paid, it is immediately non-refundable, even if you cancel the job. By paying a deposit, you confirm the job and we allocate resources accordingly (technician time, stock procurement, scheduling). This allocation means we cannot accept other jobs during that time slot. The deposit covers our costs and opportunity cost of lost business resulting from resource allocation to your confirmed job. Out of hours jobs may require payment upfront or a deposit before the technician is dispatched.

4.5 Accepted Payment Methods - We accept the following payment methods: credit and debit cards, cash, and bank transfer (typically for deposits or by prior arrangement). Payment must be made in GBP (British Pounds Sterling).
4.6 VAT - All prices quoted are inclusive of VAT at the applicable rate. A VAT receipt will be provided upon request.
5. VEHICLE TYPES AND SERVICE LIMITATIONS
5.1 Vehicles We Service - We provide services for the following vehicle types: cars, vans, caravans, motorhomes, trailers, and SUVs.

5.2 Vehicles We Do NOT Service - We do not provide services for: motorcycles or scooters, Heavy Goods Vehicles (HGVs), agricultural vehicles or machinery, or any vehicle we determine to be unsafe or unsuitable for mobile tyre fitting.

5.3 Puncture Repairs - WE DO NOT CARRY OUT PUNCTURE REPAIRS. Our service model is based on tyre replacement, not repair. If you have a damaged tyre, we will replace it with a new or suitable tyre. We do not patch, plug, or repair punctured tyres.
6. YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

6.1 Accurate Information - You must provide accurate information about your vehicle (make, model, registration), your location, the nature of the problem, and tyre specifications including tyre size and construction (i.e. run-flat/non run-flat). Inaccurate information may result in delays, inability to complete the work, or additional charges.

6.2 Safe Working Environment - You must ensure that the location where work is to be carried out is reasonably safe and accessible for our technicians. For roadside call-outs, you should position your vehicle as safely as possible and use hazard lights and warning triangles where appropriate.

6.3 Vehicle Ownership or Authority - You confirm that you are either the owner of the vehicle or have authority from the owner to instruct us to carry out work. We are not liable for any disputes regarding vehicle ownership or authority to instruct work.

6.4 Vehicle Condition - You are responsible for informing us of any pre-existing damage to your vehicle, particularly wheels, wheel studs, or locking wheel nuts. We are not responsible for pre-existing damage that is discovered during the course of our work.
7. WARRANTIES AND GUARANTEES

7.1 Workmanship Warranty - We warrant that all work will be carried out to a professional standard using appropriate tools and techniques. If you experience any issues that are directly caused by poor installation or workmanship on our part, we will investigate and rectify the issue free of charge within 30 days of the original work being completed.

7.2 Tyre Product Warranty - WE PROVIDE NO WARRANTY ON THE TYRES THEMSELVES. Tyres are manufactured goods supplied by third-party manufacturers. Any manufacturing defects or product issues with the tyres themselves are covered by the tyre manufacturer's warranty, not by us. We can assist you in pursuing a manufacturer warranty claim if required.

7.3 Exclusions from Workmanship Warranty - Our workmanship warranty does not cover: damage caused by your driving, impacts, kerbing, or misuse after we complete the work; normal wear and tear of tyres; damage caused by failure to maintain correct tyre pressures; pre-existing damage to wheels, studs, or vehicle components; work carried out by third parties after our service; or issues arising from incorrect information provided by you about your vehicle.

7.4 Making a Warranty Claim - To make a warranty claim, contact us within 30 days of the original work at contact@tyreemergency.com or 0330 133 9311. We will require details of the issue, your original invoice, and an opportunity to inspect the vehicle. We reserve the right to determine whether an issue falls within our workmanship warranty.
8. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

8.1 Liability Cap - To the fullest extent permitted by law, our total liability to you in connection with our services, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), breach of statutory duty, or otherwise, shall be limited to the total amount paid by you for the specific service giving rise to the claim.

8.2 Exclusion of Consequential Losses - We shall not be liable for any indirect, consequential, special, or punitive losses or damages, including but not limited to: loss of profits, loss of business, loss of revenue, loss of use, loss of opportunity, cost of replacement services, or any other economic loss, even if we have been advised of the possibility of such losses.

8.3 Specific Exclusions - We are not liable for: delays in reaching you due to traffic, weather, or other factors beyond our control; pre-existing damage to your vehicle, wheels, wheel studs, or components discovered during our work; damage to locking wheel nuts, wheel studs, or wheels that occurs during removal of seized, rounded, or damaged components (though we will use our best efforts to minimise such damage); TPMS sensor damage when sensors are seized, corroded, or otherwise in poor condition; issues arising from incorrect information provided by you; or manufacturer defects in tyres or parts supplied.

8.4 Roadside Work - Roadside tyre fitting carries inherent risks that do not exist in a controlled garage environment. By requesting roadside service, you acknowledge these risks. While we take all reasonable precautions, we cannot guarantee the same level of control over environmental factors (weather, road surface, traffic, lighting) as would exist in a fixed location.

8.5 Nothing in These Terms Excludes - Nothing in these Terms excludes or limits our liability for: death or personal injury caused by our negligence, fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation, or any other liability that cannot be excluded or limited under English law.
9. CANCELLATIONS AND REFUNDS
9.1 Your Right to Cancel - You may cancel a booking at any time by contacting us at 0330 133 9311 or contact@tyreemergency.com.

9.2 Cancellation of Standard Jobs (No Deposit Paid) - For standard emergency call-outs where no deposit has been taken, you may cancel without charge provided you cancel before our technician is dispatched to your location. Once our technician has been dispatched and is en route to you, we reserve the right to charge a call-out fee to cover our costs.

9.3 Cancellation Where Deposit Has Been Paid - DEPOSITS ARE NON-REFUNDABLE. If you have paid a deposit to secure your booking, that deposit will be forfeited if you cancel for any reason. This policy exists because we allocate resources (technician time, sourced parts, scheduling) immediately upon receiving your deposit, and we incur costs and opportunity costs (inability to accept other work) as a result of that allocation.

9.4 Our Right to Cancel - We reserve the right to cancel or reschedule appointments in exceptional circumstances including but not limited to: severe weather making travel unsafe, vehicle breakdown, technician illness, or other unforeseen circumstances. If we cancel, we will refund any deposit or payment made in full.
10. COMPLAINTS AND DISPUTES

10.1 How to Complain - If you are unhappy with our service, please contact us as soon as possible. Phone: 0330 133 9311. Email: contact@tyreemergency.com. We will investigate your complaint and respond within a reasonable timeframe. We aim to resolve complaints quickly and fairly.

10.2 Alternative Dispute Resolution - If we cannot resolve your complaint to your satisfaction, you may wish to use an alternative dispute resolution service. We are willing to participate in ADR to resolve disputes where appropriate.

10.3 Governing Law and Jurisdiction - These Terms are governed by the laws of England and Wales. Any disputes arising from or in connection with these Terms or our services shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of England and Wales.
11. DATA PROTECTION AND PRIVACY

We collect and process personal information in accordance with UK GDPR and the Data Protection Act 2018. For full details of how we handle your personal data, please see our Privacy Policy at https://tyreemergency.com/privacy-policy. We are registered with the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO Registration Number: ZB755609).
12. GENERAL TERMS

12.1 Entire Agreement - These Terms, together with our Privacy Policy and Cookie Policy, constitute the entire agreement between you and us regarding the provision of our services and supersede any prior agreements, representations, or understandings.

12.2 Changes to These Terms - We may update these Terms from time to time. The 'Last Updated' date at the top of this document indicates when changes were last made. Continued use of our services after changes constitutes acceptance of the revised Terms.

12.3 Severability - If any provision of these Terms is found to be unenforceable or invalid by a court of law, that provision shall be limited or eliminated to the minimum extent necessary, and the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect.
12.4 Waiver - Our failure to enforce any right or provision of these Terms shall not constitute a waiver of such right or provision unless acknowledged in writing by us.
12.5 Third Party Rights - These Terms are between you and us. No third party has any right to enforce any provision of these Terms.

12.6 Assignment - You may not assign or transfer your rights or obligations under these Terms without our prior written consent. We may assign our rights and obligations under these Terms to another company or entity without your consent.

12.7 Contact Us - If you have any questions about these Terms and Conditions, please contact us: Tyre Emergency Ltd, Newark, Nottinghamshire NG22 8GA. Phone: 0330 133 9311. Email: contact@tyreemergency.com. Website: https://tyreemergency.com
